availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David Forst (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, jeweler)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, jeweler. Native of Bavaria, Germany. Married to Carolina Reiss Forst in Hamilton County, Ohio on October 10, 1845. Father of Emaline Forst, Abram Forst, Rachel Forst, Bernhard Forst, Herman Forst, and Aaron Forst. Resident of Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio, in 1850. Jeweler in Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1860. Employed Louise Immele as a domestic in Louisville in 1860. Fined for assaulting Elisabeth Sidle in Louisville in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 6, p. 25B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 4, p. 62.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Ward 8, p. 117A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994040, Jefferson County Births.
Ohio Marriage Records, 1774-1993, Hamilton County Marriages, Film 000344457, p. 190.
